names.pinyin: pi pa ye qing fei tang

actions: Transforms Phlegm, clears Lung Heat and descends Lung Qi.
With Xing Ren, for Lung Heat induced non-productive cough, or cough with viscous sputum that is difficult to expectorate, with chest pain and a dry throat.
Stops cough and calms wheezing.
Clears Heat, promotes urination, unblocks painful urinary dysfunction and expels stones.
Harmonizes the Stomach and transforms turbid Dampness.
Promotes urination, clears Damp-Heat, clears the Lungs, expels Phlegm and stops cough.
With Ze Xie, for Lin Syndrome, edema and distention.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and settles Ministerial Fire in the Kidneys by draining Damp-Heat from the lower Jiao.
With Mu Tong, for Lin Syndrome with scanty urine and edema.

With Chi Fu Ling, facilitates the removal of water and leaches out Dampness to treat stagnant water and Dampness leading to edema, jaundice, diarrhea, Milky Lin, and scanty, difficult urination with abdominal distention.
Dispels Damp-Heat.
With Chi Fu Ling, for Lin syndrome, scanty urine, edema, loose stools, vaginal discharge, jaundice, leg Qi and diarrhea.
With Ze Xie, drains Damp, unblocks and drains urinary pathways and drains Heat from the Bladder.
Promotes urination and unblocks painful urinary dysfunction.
With Ze Xie, for Pelvic infections.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and reduces swelling.
Opens the Lungs, spreads Lung Qi, expels Phlegm and benefits the throat.
Clears Lung Heat
Moves Qi
Disinhibits water

symptoms: Drips and drops, but lack of free flow
A dry throat with a desire to drink
